key_points: The third batch of California stimulus checks will be sent out on Oct. 5.
These payments are part of the Golden State Stimulus program.
The size of the upcoming batch is currently unknown, but previous batches were sent to 2 million and 600,000 Californians respectively.
It's estimated that about 9 million Californians are eligible for the payments.
This round will include mailed paper checks in addition to direct deposits.
Payments are being sent in two-week intervals, with previous ones on Aug. 27 and Sept. 17.
The California Franchise Tax Board provides a tool for estimating individual payment amounts.
Eligibility and payment amounts vary based on previous stimulus qualification and claiming of dependents.
Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a bill on July 12 that includes $12 billion in pandemic relief.
The stimulus aims to address inequities and support those facing the greatest hardship due to the pandemic.
